definition: to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: Xin qiji once said: "young not sorrow taste".
sentences.chinese: 年轻人，会有一些挥之不去的烦恼。

sentences.english: The danger of war is looming, and hot issues keep cropping up.
sentences.chinese: 战争阴云挥之不去，热点问题此起彼伏。

sentences.english: For any viewer, the effect is no less haunting.
sentences.chinese: 对于所有观影者来说，这种效果也是挥之不去的。

sentences.english: This is an image that I will always keep in my head.
sentences.chinese: 而这个形象也一直保存在我的脑海中，挥之不去。

sentences.english: It's a long list and soon I can't get it off my mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的礼单挺长，且在我脑海中挥之不去。

sentences.english: When I arrived at the camp I put my bag down and just cried. That feeling still won't go.
sentences.chinese: 一到营房放下包就开始哭泣，那种感觉至今挥之不去。

sentences.english: It enveloped the story in a fog of mystification.
sentences.chinese: 笼罩这个问题的迷雾挥之不去。

sentences.english: Loneliness as a theme has been sticking to the Latin-American literature.
sentences.chinese: 孤独是拉美文学中一个挥之不去的主题。

sentences.english: Fear is nothing more than a lingering emotion that’ s fueled by your imagination.
sentences.chinese: 恐惧不过是想象力产生的一种挥之不去的情感。

sentences.english: The puzzle niggled away in Arnold's mind.
sentences.chinese: 这个谜团在阿诺德脑海里挥之不去。

sentences.english: It plays on every serious reader’s lingering sense of inadequacy.
sentences.chinese: 他作用于对所有认真的读者挥之不去的不适感。

sentences.english: The name Liuyuan or Lingering Garden actually means lingering in the world.
sentences.chinese: 柳园的名称或留园实际上意味着在世界上挥之不去。

sentences.english: But the lingering question is, Why at sea?
sentences.chinese: 但另一个挥之不去的问题是，为什么选择的是海葬？

sentences.english: I do think gun nuts have a power hang-up.
sentences.chinese: 我的确认为，枪迷们有一种挥之不去的权力欲。

definition: lit. as if having a fish bone stuck in one's throat (idiom)/fig. very upset and needing to express one's displeasure
central point/in one's thoughts/in one's heart
to miss/to yearn day and night
as the shadow follows the body (idiom)/closely associated with each other/to follow relentlessly
lit. carved in bones and engraved in the heart (idiom)/fig. etched in one's memory/unforgettable
